definition: to be entirely on one side/one-sided/lopsided/partisan/overwhelmingly on one side
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
face/side/surface/aspect/top/classifier for flat surfaces such as drums, mirrors, flags etc
to fall/to collapse/to lie horizontally/to overthrow/to fail/to go bankrupt/to change (trains or buses)/to move around/to resell at a profit
to place upside down/to invert/to pour/to throw out/to move backwards/however/actually/as a matter of fact/contrary to expectation

sentences.english: Being able to opens up the vulnerable side requires relatively much more courage.
sentences.chinese: 能夠倘開軟弱的一面倒需要更加的堅強。

sentences.english: But trade flows are terribly lopsided.
sentences.chinese: 但貿易流動嚴重一面倒。

definition: to have the advantage overwhelmingly on one side/to support unconditionally
utterly defeated/routed/crushed/to collapse (of army)
evenly matched (idiom)
troops in defeat like a landslide (idiom); a beaten army in total collapse
to change sides in a war/turncoat
chaotic warfare/confused fighting/melee/to join in such fighting
war situation
to retreat again and again in defeat/to suffer defeat after defeat
overwhelming
the enemy and us
situation/circumstance
to develop rapidly after abrupt turn (idiom); dramatic change
at a stalemate/deadlocked/in unrelenting mutual opposition
to retreat in defeat
grasp it and victory is assured/to have success within one's grasp (idiom)
both sides (in contract)/the two opposing sides (in a dispute)
